title: Possessive Adjectives
description: my, your, his, her, its, our, their â€“ show ownership.

subtopics.title: Basic Forms
subtopics.description: Use the correct adjective before a noun to show who it belongs to.

examples.sample: This is my car. Is that your bag?
Her house is big. The dog wagged its tail.

subtopics.title: Common Mistakes
subtopics.description: Avoid confusing possessive adjectives with contractions or pronouns.

examples.sample: The company changed its logo. It's more modern now.
Their car is new because they're rich.

exercises.instruction: Replace the noun with the correct possessive adjective.
exercises.sentence: The car of my parents is old.
